text: John Alfred Williams (December 5, 1925 â€“ July 3, 2015) was an African-American author, journalist, and academic. His novel The Man Who Cried I Am was a bestseller in 1967. Marnie Eisenstadt, "Author John A. Williams dies; Syracuse University alum wrote best-selling novel", Syracuse.com, July 7, 2015. Williams was born in Jackson, Mississippi. He studied at Syracuse University. Williams died in Paramus, New Jersey from Alzheimer's disease, aged 89.William Grimes, "John A. Williams, 89, Dies; Underrated Novelist Who Wrote About Black Identity", New York Times, July 6, 2015. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Educators from Mississippi Category:Journalists from Mississippi Category:People from Jackson, Mississippi
title: John A. Williams
